item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "So far, about morals, I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it off to forced conscious expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A lady came up to me one day and said 'Sir! You are drunk', to which I replied 'I am drunk today madam, and tomorrow I shall be sober but you will still be ugly." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Love is where you find it. I think it is foolish to go around looking for it, and I think it can be poisonous. I wish that people who are conventionally supposed to love each other would say to each other, when they fight, 'Please — a little less love, and a little more common decency'." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "Sometimes I think it is a great mistake to have matter that can think and feel. It complains so. By the same token, though, I suppose that boulders and mountains and moons could be accused of being a little too phlegmatic." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rudy Kye add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Let me tell you what I think of bicycling. I think it has done more to emancipate women than anything else in the world. It gives women a feeling of freedom and self-reliance. I stand and rejoice every time I see a woman ride by on a wheel…the picture of free, untrammeled womanhood." -- Susan B. Anthony
